name: Brand new help DD weapon master
author: Malvus

posts.author: Malvus
posts.content:
I'm 100% new to neverwinter I just downloaded it the other day. One of those games I remember hearing alot about when it came out but never got around to it.

So I've always had trouble with DnD games cause they can be a bit overwhelming. I'm looking to make a weapon master that uses 2 handed axe or sword. I'm leaning heavily towards dwarf cause DD defense + offense seems beastly. Although I am open to half orc builds. Don't need to worry about any spells . Figured fighter/wm/DD is all I need.I really just need a breakdown of when and what lvls of classes, feats and skills I will need. I think it's going to be max level of 20? Not sure how high it goes I'm only playing offline.

Thanks for any help you guys can give. Been jumping into a lot of old RPGs I never got to play!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hi there, Malvus - and welcome!

I understand entirely the concept of Fighter/ Weapon Master/ Dwarven Defender - indeed, it was my first published build here (Grim Stonefoot), but I'm less sure about it now. I'm now much more tempted by the idea of either a great DwD or a great WM. It's hard to get both to work properly. A full-blooded DwD is exactly that: a defender, so pumping in damage resistance is great, and soaking up damage is important, as in - "You shall not pass!"

On the other hand, Weapon Master is primarily about bobbing and weaving while delivering critical hits - more "get out of my way, and do it quickly". There's probably a clue in that WM doesn't have Heavy Armour built in.

There are better solutions out there, I think. But you need to be sure about what you want.

You'll notice that I'm fudging - this is until someone who knows more comes along...

EDIT: If you'd like a look at Grim's build, it's on page 4 of the Full Epic sub-forum.

posts.author: Malvus
posts.content: I actually did check it out. Just curious as a newbie why no cleave? Only been dabbling a bit but it seems so good from what I've been seeing.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I'd have liked to have Cleave, but I'd need to take Power Attack before it (IKD would have been my choice to lose, if it was only one feat), and I simply didn't have enough feats to take them both - WM needing so many qualifiers - part of the problem, really.

EDIT: If you want a stupendous DwD build, have a look at the Hearth Guard on the first page of  the Full Epic sub-forum (I made some changes to it, that you can find in the link there).

posts.author: Malvus
posts.content: Hrmmm well would delaying WM till you can get the feats work? Even willing to drop DD like you originally stated.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Alas, no. The only way to get more feats would be going human - so DwD becomes unavailable - thus it's all a bit "aargh!" I suppose you could lose something else (Imp Crit or Blind Fighting maybe), but think about what you'd be sacrificing for an extra potential hit...

As I hinted at, the immediate appeal of a character that excels at both offence and defence is alluring, but the sods won't let you do it properly, damn them! In the meantime...

posts.author: Malvus
posts.content: Hmm well could you recommend a great 2 handed build that doesn't die in 3 hits? I just want to smash through single and multiple targets with a big old sword or axe. 2 hand weapons are usually my favorite style in RPGs. Even though they are mediocre most of the time.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Welcome to the game & the ECB guild Malvus,

You could try Magaiti's "Weaponized Wall" found here => weaponized-wall-fighter-7-weapon-master ... 54271.html


You just have to make three changes for playability's sake.

1st) Replace Iron Will with Knockdown (and use it!)

2nd) Put back the 7th Weapon Master lvl where it belongs (since you want a 20th lvl version of this build) back in 13th lvl.

3rd) Select an appropriate Dwarvish weapon such as a Greataxe for your weapon of choice.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
There is also the old Fighter / Bard / RDD stand-by. Ten levels of RDD gives you +8 strength for better AB and damage, and also +4 AC to get hit less often.
A level 40 version of this would be more powerful, but this should kick butt. Those 9 points I put in Lore near the end can go wherever you want, but the 8 near the beginning are required to get RDD. The build is in the spoiler.
